inbound.title: Inbound Process (Inbound)
inbound.description: The complete process where a shipper registers an inbound plan in the FULGO WMS, and the logistics company receives and stores the products in the warehouse. The FULGO platform tracks and manages all progress in real-time.

steps.label: OMS Inbound Request
steps.desc: Shipper submits inbound request via OMS
steps.detail: Shipper submits inbound request through FULGO OMS: ① Input required items (product code, quantity, expected delivery date, tracking number) ② Specify inbound type (regular/urgent inbound) ③ Submit request. OMS generates inbound request data. Status: REQUEST_PENDING

steps.label: OMS to WMS Data Transmission
steps.desc: OMS sends inbound data to WMS
steps.detail: FULGO OMS transmits inbound request data to FULGO WMS: ① Send inbound request details ② SKU-based mapping ③ Send validation data together. WMS receives and validates data. Status: DATA_RECEIVED

steps.label: WMS Inbound Validation & Approval Decision
steps.desc: Auto-validate inbound data and determine if approval needed
steps.detail: FULGO WMS internal engine validates inbound data: ① Auto-classify inbound type ② Verify warehouse capacity ③ Determine approval conditions (new shipper/bulk inbound/special products). If approval needed: request warehouse manager. If not needed: proceed. Status: APPROVAL_PENDING or READY

steps.label: Request Warehouse Manager Approval
steps.desc: Direct approval request to warehouse manager
steps.detail: FULGO WMS requests approval from warehouse manager: ① Present inbound request details ② Specify approval reasons (new shipper/bulk inbound/special products, etc.) ③ Request review. Status: Awaiting Approval

steps.label: Process Inbound Approval
steps.desc: Review inbound suitability and make approval decision
steps.detail: Warehouse manager reviews by: ① Warehouse capacity (zone availability/quantity) ② Product appropriateness (condition/storage area) ③ Restricted items. If approved: APPROVED, if rejected: REJECTED + reason and report to FULGO WMS. Status: APPROVED or REJECTED

steps.label: Assign Zone and Issue Inbound Instruction
steps.desc: Auto-assign location and issue inbound work instruction
steps.detail: FULGO WMS auto-assigns locations by product policy: Select appropriate zone by size/color/category. Assign location code. Issue inbound instruction to workers: ① Assigned location info ② Product info (code/quantity/shipment info) ③ Deliver to workers. Status: Awaiting Inbound

steps.label: Complete Inbound Execution Report
steps.desc: Confirm receipt and placement to assigned location
steps.detail: Workers perform inbound work: ① Receive products and scan barcode ② Verify quantity/damage/condition ③ Move products to assigned zone ④ Conduct inspection (verify quantity/damage/condition) ⑤ Report inbound completion to FULGO. Status: INBOUND_CONFIRMED

steps.label: Update Inventory Status & OMS Synchronization
steps.desc: Change inventory status upon inbound completion and sync with OMS
steps.detail: FULGO WMS internal inventory engine processes inbound completion: ① Change inventory status (inbound→available) ② Increase inventory quantity ③ Send inbound confirmed data to OMS ④ Register tracking info ⑤ Check inventory consistency. Final OMS synchronization. Status: COMPLETED

steps.label: Exception Handling & Real-time Monitoring
steps.desc: Detect and respond to abnormal situations (delayed approval/zone saturation/inspection failure)
steps.detail: FULGO WMS dashboard auto-detects and alerts on exceptions: ① Approval delay (exceeds 2-hour target)→auto-notify ② Zone saturation (capacity 90%+)→register in ZONE_WAITING queue, auto-reallocation proposal ③ Inspection failure→HOLD status, request re-inspection ④ Info mismatch→confirm and adjust products. Real-time visualization by request/validation/approval/inbound/completion.

steps.label: KPI Reporting & Analysis
steps.desc: Generate and analyze inbound efficiency and performance report
steps.detail: FULGO WMS auto-generates daily/weekly/monthly reports. KPI: average approval time, rejection rate (%), inbound delay rate, zone saturation rate, inventory consistency rate (%). Includes trend analysis and improvement recommendations.

outbound.title: Outbound Process (Outbound)
outbound.description: The complete process where orders are received from external channels, OMS processes them, WMS issues outbound instructions, workers pick/inspect/pack/ship products, and real-time tracking information is provided. Includes inventory allocation prioritization, picking optimization, mandatory inspection, automatic barcode generation, and real-time OMS synchronization.

steps.label: Order Reception
steps.desc: Sales channel receives and creates order
steps.detail: Sales channel creates order information: ① Generate order number, order contents (product list, quantity), delivery address ② Register order information in channel system ③ Send order to shipper system. Channel system creates order data. Status: ORDER_RECEIVED

steps.label: OMS Order Reception & Processing
steps.desc: OMS receives and processes order
steps.detail: FULGO OMS receives order from channel: ① Receive order information from channel ② Verify order content (product existence, quantity check) ③ Confirm payment status ④ Assign shipper. OMS registers order data and creates outbound task. Status: ORDER_CONFIRMED

steps.label: Outbound Request Transmission & Inventory Allocation
steps.desc: WMS receives outbound request and allocates inventory
steps.detail: FULGO WMS receives outbound request: ① Receive order details from OMS ② Verify inventory availability by SKU ③ Allocate inventory quantity needed ④ Reserve inventory for this order ⑤ Generate outbound task. Status: INVENTORY_ALLOCATED

steps.label: Outbound Instruction Issuance
steps.desc: WMS issues picking and packing instructions
steps.detail: FULGO WMS issues detailed outbound instructions: ① Assign picking location (zone-location) ② Group orders for efficient picking (wave assignment) ③ Create picking list with barcode ④ Create packing slip with tracking info ⑤ Send instructions to warehouse workers. Status: INSTRUCTION_ISSUED

steps.label: Picking
steps.desc: Worker picks products from shelves
steps.detail: Warehouse worker executes picking: ① Receive picking instructions from WMS ② Navigate to assigned locations ③ Scan product barcodes ④ Verify quantity matches order ⑤ Collect products to designated collection area. Status: PICKING_COMPLETE

steps.label: Inspection
steps.desc: Quality check before packing
steps.detail: Worker performs quality inspection: ① Verify picked products match order list ② Check for damage or defects ③ Verify product condition and expiry dates ④ Confirm quantity accuracy. If issues found, report exceptions to supervisor. Status: INSPECTION_COMPLETE

steps.label: Packing
steps.desc: Pack products and attach shipping label
steps.detail: Worker prepares shipment: ① Receive packing instructions with tracking number ② Pack products into box using packing list ③ Add packing materials for protection ④ Print and attach shipping label with tracking number ⑤ Weigh package and verify dimensions. Status: PACKING_COMPLETE

steps.label: Shipping Completion Report
steps.desc: Report shipment ready for pickup
steps.detail: Warehouse team reports to WMS: ① Confirm all orders packed and ready ② Report tracking numbers for each shipment ③ Move packages to shipping dock ④ Update shipment status in WMS ⑤ Notify carrier that shipment is ready. Status: READY_FOR_PICKUP

steps.label: Shipping Tracking API Integration
steps.desc: Real-time shipment tracking
steps.detail: FULGO WMS integrates with shipping providers: ① Carrier picks up packages from warehouse ② Carrier updates tracking status in real-time ③ WMS receives tracking updates (picked up, in transit, out for delivery, delivered) ④ Synchronize tracking data with OMS ⑤ Provide real-time tracking to customers. Status: IN_TRANSIT / DELIVERED

steps.label: Outbound Completion & OMS Synchronization
steps.desc: Final confirmation and data sync
steps.detail: FULGO completes outbound process: ① Confirm final delivery status from carrier ② Reduce reserved inventory permanently ③ Update sales performance metrics ④ Synchronize completed order status to OMS ⑤ Generate KPI report (delivery time, accuracy rate). Status: ORDER_DELIVERED / ORDER_COMPLETED

return.title: Return Process (Return)
return.description: The complete process where a customer requests a return due to a product issue, the logistics company receives and inspects the product, and either returns it to inventory or disposes of it. Includes return policy validation, inspection grading (A/B/C), three processing paths (re-stocking/defect/disposal), and documentation management.

steps.label: Return Request
steps.desc: Customer initiates return request
steps.detail: Customer requests return through shipper's customer service: ① Contact shipper customer service ② Report product issue (damaged, defective, wrong item) ③ Request return authorization ④ Provide order number and reason for return. Status: RETURN_REQUESTED

steps.label: OMS Return Reception & Policy Validation
steps.desc: OMS receives and validates return request
steps.detail: FULGO OMS receives return request: ① Validate return request with order information ② Check return policy (eligibility, return window, condition) ③ Verify product status and warranty ④ Generate return authorization number ⑤ Register return request in system. Status: RETURN_AUTHORIZED

steps.label: WMS Return Inbound Instruction
steps.desc: WMS issues return inbound instruction
steps.detail: FULGO WMS receives return request from OMS: ① Assign return receiving location in warehouse ② Schedule receiving time/date ③ Generate return label with return authorization code ④ Create receiving instruction ⑤ Notify warehouse team of expected return. Status: RETURN_LOCATION_ASSIGNED

steps.label: Return Product Reception
steps.desc: Warehouse receives returned product
steps.detail: Worker receives return shipment: ① Receive package from carrier at warehouse ② Scan return authorization barcode ③ Verify product details match authorization ④ Confirm package condition ⑤ Register receipt in WMS. Status: RETURN_RECEIVED

steps.label: Return Inspection
steps.desc: Inspect returned product condition
steps.detail: Worker inspects returned product: ① Open and examine product condition ② Check for damage, defects, missing parts ③ Verify product is the original item ④ Document condition with photos if needed ⑤ Classify product into grades (A/B/C). Status: INSPECTION_COMPLETE

steps.label: Processing Path Execution
steps.desc: Execute processing based on product grade
steps.detail: Worker executes processing based on grade: Grade A (Resaleable) - ① Clean if needed ② Repackage ③ Apply fresh label; Grade B (Needs Repair) - ① Send to repair station ② Process repair; Grade C (Dispose) - ① Segregate defective items ② Send to disposal area. Status: PROCESSING_COMPLETE

steps.label: Final Re-stocking/Disposal Approval
steps.desc: WMS approves final inventory disposition
steps.detail: FULGO WMS finalizes inventory treatment: ① Review processing results from warehouse ② Grade A: Approve for re-stocking to inventory ③ Grade B: Route to repair or clearance ④ Grade C: Approve for disposal ⑤ Update WMS inventory records accordingly. Status: APPROVAL_COMPLETE

steps.label: Final Return Settlement & Completion
steps.desc: Complete return process and settlement
steps.detail: FULGO finalizes return: ① Sync final inventory status to OMS ② Calculate refund amount based on product condition ③ Process refund to customer ④ Send return completion notice to shipper ⑤ Generate return KPI report (inspection accuracy, processing time). Status: RETURN_COMPLETED

storage.title: Storage & Inventory Management (Storage)
storage.description: The daily operations where the logistics company efficiently manages warehouse space, and FULGO accurately tracks inventory status by shipper.

steps.label: Classify & Track Inventory Status
steps.desc: Distinguish and auto-track available/reserved/hold/defective status
steps.detail: FULGO WMS internal inventory engine automatically tracks inventory status in real-time by lifecycle: ① Available - sellable normal inventory ② Reserved - inventory allocated by outbound orders before picking ③ Picking - inventory under picking operation ④ Hold - inventory awaiting inspection or unsellable due to issues ⑤ Defective - unsellable defective products ⑥ To be Disposed - inventory pending disposal approval. All status changes are auto-recorded.

steps.label: Real-time Inventory Quantity Management
steps.desc: Manage 4-level inventory: physical/available/reserved/safety stock
steps.detail: FULGO WMS internally manages 4 types of inventory quantities in real-time: ① Physical Inventory - actual products in warehouse ② Available Inventory - sellable quantity (=physical-reserved-hold) ③ Reserved Inventory - quantity allocated by outbound orders ④ Safety Stock - minimum quantity to maintain per shipper policy. Auto-updated at inbound/outbound/adjustment/return.

steps.label: Set Warehouse Structure
steps.desc: Define zone-location system and register in FULGO
steps.detail: Warehouse manager registers warehouse basic structure in FULGO: Zone - define major areas (clothing zone/accessories zone/shoes zone/hold zone/defective zone/disposal zone). Set capacity, characteristics, and management policies per zone. Location - set detailed location code system (A-01-01 format: zone-row-column). Set and apply FIFO/FEFO policies in FULGO.

steps.label: Register Storage Locations
steps.desc: Register detailed information for physical locations
steps.detail: Warehouse manager registers detailed storage location information in FULGO: ① Zone-location mapping (register physical locations A-01-01~A-05-10 in zone A) ② Input location characteristics (size/height/weight limit/humidity control requirement/product category) ③ Set product-location affinity (clothing→humidity control, electronics→ESD protection zone, etc.) ④ Set storage rate (size-based daily/monthly rate). Complete registration of all warehouse locations in FULGO.

steps.label: Assign Location & Issue Placement Instructions
steps.desc: Auto-assign locations based on product attributes and instruct workers
steps.detail: FULGO auto-assigns locations for inbound products and instructs workers: ① Verify product attributes (category/size/quantity) ② Select appropriate zone ③ Auto-search for vacant location ④ Complete location assignment ⑤ Send placement instruction to workers (with QR code/location map). Auto-notify and suggest reallocation if zone reaches capacity.

steps.label: Report Placement & Movement Completion
steps.desc: Report completion of placement/movement work and record history
steps.detail: Workers report placement/movement completion to FULGO: ① Verify work completion (barcode scan confirmation) ② FULGO auto-records all inventory movements: Inbound (OMS→WMS→Location A)→Movement (Location A→B)→Picking (Location A→Pick zone)→Outbound (Pick zone→Shipping)→Return (Return zone→Location A) ③ Track by lot/serial number ④ Full history available for query.

steps.label: Set Inventory Operation Policy
steps.desc: Manage inventory operation policy by shipper/product
steps.detail: Warehouse manager sets inventory operation policies in FULGO: ① Shipper policy - safety stock (by product), FIFO/FEFO rotation policy, lot/expiration management ② Inventory classification - ABC analysis (A: high frequency 20%, B: medium frequency 30%, C: low frequency 50%) ③ Holding cost - storage fees (daily/monthly basis), long-term storage premium, zone-specific rates. FULGO applies policies for auto-operation.

steps.label: Direct Physical Inventory
steps.desc: Warehouse manager instructs workers to conduct physical inventory
steps.detail: Warehouse manager issues physical inventory instructions periodically (weekly/monthly) or as needed: ① Decide physical inventory scope (all/by zone/by product) ② Set physical inventory period ③ Assign physical inventory staff ④ Deliver physical inventory instructions to workers (generate physical inventory sheet). Status: Awaiting Physical Inventory

steps.label: Perform Physical Inventory
steps.desc: Workers conduct physical inventory in the field
steps.detail: Workers perform physical inventory: ① Move to target area ② Barcode scan and verify quantity by product ③ Inspect for damage/deformation/wear ④ Real-time input of physical inventory status (mobile device) ⑤ Submit to FULGO upon completion. Status: Physical Inventory Complete

steps.label: Report Physical Inventory Results & Analysis
steps.desc: Compare results with WMS inventory and report to shipper
steps.detail: FULGO WMS auto-analyzes physical inventory results: ① Compare physical quantity vs WMS quantity ② Analyze discrepancy patterns (increase/decrease/loss) ③ Generate anomalies list (suspected theft/errors/damage) ④ Create physical inventory report ⑤ Report results to shipper (discrepancy rate %, problem items, recommendations). Status: Awaiting Validation

steps.label: Adjust Inventory Quantity
steps.desc: Execute quantity adjustment based on physical inventory results
steps.detail: Workers execute quantity adjustments per warehouse manager approval based on results: ① Increase (from omitted inbound, etc.)→input in system (process as inbound) ② Decrease (from theft/damage, etc.)→input in system (process as disposal/deduction) ③ Relocate if needed→reposition locations ④ Verify completion by barcode scan ⑤ Report adjustment completion to FULGO. Status: Adjustment Complete

steps.label: Confirm Adjustment & Synchronize with OMS
steps.desc: Finalize adjustment results and synchronize with OMS
steps.detail: FULGO WMS finalizes quantity adjustment: ① Validate adjustment contents (verify increase/decrease amounts) ② Final inventory state change (=confirm as physical inventory quantity) ③ Record adjustment log (datetime/handler/reason/quantity change) ④ Send final sync to OMS (WMS inventory = OMS inventory) ⑤ Re-validate consistency. Status: Adjustment Confirmed

steps.label: Real-time Inventory Monitoring Dashboard
steps.desc: Provide real-time inventory status to shipper
steps.detail: FULGO dashboard provides real-time inventory status to shippers: ① Overall inventory status (available/reserved/hold/defective ratios) ② Inventory distribution by zone and utilization rate ③ Inventory status and trends by shipper ④ Inventory turnover rate ⑤ Latest physical inventory results (consistency %). Auto-alerts: Below safety stock→alert, Seasonal products near end of season (30 days before)→alert, Long-term inventory (90+ days unsold)→alert

steps.label: Inventory KPI Reporting
steps.desc: Auto-generate and provide daily/weekly/monthly KPIs
steps.detail: FULGO auto-generates reports: ① Inventory Accuracy (%) - consistency rate from physical inventory ② Inventory Turnover Rate - outbound vs inbound ratio ③ Average Holding Period - days from inbound to outbound ④ Zone Utilization Rate (%) - usage vs capacity ⑤ Inventory Value Change - quantity × unit cost ⑥ Loss Analysis - scale of damage/theft/loss. Includes shipper-specific reports, trend analysis, and improvement recommendations.

hierarchyInfo.title: Hierarchy Structure
hierarchyInfo.description: This process consists of 3 major layers:
hierarchyInfo.layer1Desc: System management · Policy establishment · Data integration · Inventory tracking
hierarchyInfo.layer2Desc: Warehouse operations · Actual in/out work · Worker management · Customer service
hierarchyInfo.layer3Desc: Product owner · In/out requests · Inventory inquiry · Sales management

features.title: WMS Feature Specification
features.subtitle: 50 Core Functions Detailed Definition · Oct 21, 2025

priorityGuide.title: Priority Definition
priorityGuide.high: (Critical) Core system features that must be implemented within 1 month
priorityGuide.medium: (Important) Features that improve operational efficiency, recommended within 2-3 months
priorityGuide.low: (Optional) Additional features that can be implemented after 4-6 months

features.STK-001-desc: Search product information by code, name, and specification
features.STK-001-input:
Search Term (Product Code/Name)
Search Type (Code/Name/Spec)
Page Number (Optional)
features.STK-001-output:
Product ID, Product Code, Product Name
Specification, Category
Total Stock, Available Stock
Product Image URL
features.STK-001-process:
User inputs search term
Select search type (Code/Name/Spec)
Search matching products in DB
Paginate results (default 20 per page)
Aggregate current stock for each product
Display product list on screen
features.STK-002-desc: View current inventory quantity and status classification by product
features.STK-002-output:
Product ID, Product Code
Normal Stock, Reserved Stock, Defective Stock
Total Stock, Warehouse Details
Last Update Time
features.STK-002-process:
Receive Product ID
Query warehouse-specific inventory data
Aggregate by status (Normal/Reserved/Defective)
Format warehouse-specific details
Query last update time
Return query results
features.STK-003-desc: Manually input and save inbound quantity
features.STK-003-input:
Product ID, Inbound Qty, Lot Number (Required)
Expiration Date (Optional)
Warehouse ID, Supplier ID
Inbound Handler
features.STK-003-output:
Inbound ID, Inbound Datetime
Inbound Status (Complete/Failed)
Updated Stock
Inbound Record
features.STK-003-process:
Inbound handler searches and selects product
Input inbound qty, lot number, expiration date
Select inbound warehouse
Validate inbound information (check required fields)
Query existing stock quantity
UPDATE stock quantity (normal_stock += inbound_qty)
Create and save inbound record
Log inbound history
Return completion message and inbound ID
features.STK-004-desc: Manually input and save outbound quantity
features.STK-004-input:
Product ID, Outbound Qty (Required)
Order ID (Optional)
Warehouse ID, Outbound Reason
Outbound Handler
features.STK-004-output:
Outbound ID, Outbound Datetime
Outbound Status (Complete/Failed/Insufficient Stock)
Updated Stock
Outbound Record
features.STK-004-process:
Outbound handler selects product
Input outbound quantity
Select outbound reason (Sale/Return/Disposal)
Check available stock
Return error if insufficient, continue if sufficient
UPDATE stock quantity (normal_stock -= outbound_qty)
Create outbound record
Log outbound history
Return completion message
features.STK-005-desc: Automatically recognize products by barcode scanning
features.STK-005-output:
Product ID, Product Code
Product Name, Current Stock
Barcode Status (Valid/Invalid)
features.STK-005-process:
Receive barcode data from scanner
Validate barcode format (length, check digit)
Search for product matching barcode in DB
Return 'Invalid Barcode' if product not found
Query product information and current stock
Display appropriate screen/form based on scan purpose
Return product information
features.STK-006-input:
Warehouse ID (Required)
Zone ID (Optional)
Product Category (Optional)
features.STK-006-output:
Warehouse Name, Zone List
Total Products, Total Quantity
Occupancy Rate (%)
features.STK-006-process:
Receive Warehouse ID
Query all zones in the warehouse
Query product list for each zone
Calculate number of products and total quantity per zone
Query warehouse capacity information
Calculate occupancy rate (current quantity / max capacity)
Filter by category if filter exists
Display results on screen (table/chart)
features.STK-007-desc: Automatically generate and print barcodes by product
features.STK-007-input:
Product ID (Required)
Barcode Type (CODE128/EAN13/QR)
Print Quantity (Optional)
features.STK-007-output:
Barcode ID, Barcode Image
Barcode Value
Generation Status (Complete/Failed)
features.STK-007-process:
Select product
Select barcode type
Call barcode library
Generate barcode string based on Product ID
Generate barcode image
Apply print quantity
Save barcode record
Prepare for printing
features.STK-008-desc: Register and view scheduled inbound dates by supplier
features.STK-008-input:
Supplier ID, Product ID (Required)
Scheduled Quantity, Scheduled Date (Required)
Purchase Order Number (Optional)
features.STK-008-output:
Schedule ID
Registration Status (Registered/Modified/Cancelled)
Schedule List, Schedule Status
features.STK-008-process:
Select supplier and product
Input scheduled inbound quantity
Input scheduled date
Input purchase order number (optional)
Validate schedule information
Create inbound schedule record
Send inbound schedule notification to supplier (optional)
Reflect in schedule list
features.STK-009-desc: Bulk input of product information via CSV file
features.STK-009-input:
CSV File (Required)
Matching Method (New Registration/Update Existing/Both)
Duplicate Handling (Skip/Error Alert/Overwrite)
features.STK-009-output:
Batch Processing ID
Processing Status (Processing/Complete/Partial/Failed)
Success Count, Failure Count
Error List
features.STK-009-process:
Select CSV file
Select matching method (New/Update/Both)
Select duplicate handling method
Validate CSV file format
Parse data by row
Validate each row data
Start batch processing
Record success/failure
Generate processing result report
features.STK-010-desc: Compare planned and actual inventory and record differences
features.STK-010-input:
Product ID, Count Quantity (Required)
Warehouse ID, Counter (Required)
Count Reason (Optional)
features.STK-010-output:
Count ID, Expected Quantity
Actual Count, Difference
Difference Rate (%)
Processing Status (Pending Approval/Approved/Rejected)
features.STK-010-process:
Select product and warehouse
Query current DB expected quantity
Counter inputs actual quantity
Compare expected vs actual quantity
Calculate difference and difference rate
Proceed to separate approval process if difference occurs
Modify DB upon approval completion
Save count record and modification history
features.STK-011-input:
Product ID, Change Quantity (Required)
Current Status, Target Status (Required)
Change Reason (Optional)
features.STK-011-output:
Change ID
Change Complete (Success/Failed)
Pre-Change Status Distribution, Post-Change Status Distribution
Change Time
features.STK-011-process:
Select product and input change quantity
Select current status and target status
Verify change quantity exists in current status
Decrease current status quantity after verification
Increase target status quantity
Create status change record
Save change history log
Return completion message
features.STK-012-desc: View available inventory for immediate outbound
features.STK-012-output:
Product ID
Normal Stock, Reserved Stock
Available Quantity (Normal - Reserved)
Available by Warehouse
features.STK-012-process:
Receive Product ID
Query normal stock for the product
Query reserved stock for the product
Calculate available quantity (Normal - Reserved)
Query warehouse-specific details (optional)
Return results
features.STK-013-desc: Track product inbound/outbound history and movement path
features.STK-013-input:
Product ID (Required)
Period Filter (All/1 Month/3 Months/6 Months)
Movement Type (All/Inbound/Outbound)
features.STK-013-output:
Movement History (Date, Type, Quantity, Handler, Memo)
Inbound Cumulative, Outbound Cumulative
Path Map
features.STK-013-process:
Receive Product ID
Apply period filter
Query all inbound/outbound records for period from DB
Apply movement type filter (Inbound/Outbound)
Sort in reverse chronological order
Calculate cumulative amounts
Map movement path
Display results in timeline format on screen
features.STK-014-input:
Product ID (Optional)
Inquiry Period (Last 3/6/12 Months)
Grouping (By Product/By Category)
features.STK-014-output:
Monthly Data (Month, Opening Stock, Inbound, Outbound, Closing Stock)
Trend Chart, Growth Rate
Average Stock
features.STK-014-process:
Select inquiry period
Query first-day stock for each month
Aggregate monthly inbound amount
Aggregate monthly outbound amount
Calculate month-end stock
Calculate monthly growth rate
Calculate average stock
Generate trend chart
Display on report screen
features.STK-015-desc: Automatic alert notification when inventory is low
features.STK-015-input:
Product ID (Required)
Alert Threshold (Required)
Notification Method (Email/SMS/Screen/All)
features.STK-015-output:
Alert ID
Setting Status (Active/Inactive)
Current Stock, Alert Status
features.STK-015-process:
Select product
Set alert threshold
Select notification method
Save settings
System monitors periodically
Alert triggered when current stock < threshold
Send notification via configured method
Record alert history
features.PIC-001-desc: View list of orders waiting for picking
features.PIC-001-input:
Sort Order (By Receipt/By Scheduled Delivery)
Filter Status (All/Urgent/Normal)
features.PIC-001-output:
Order List (Order ID, Customer Name, Product, Order Qty, Receipt Time)
Total Count, Urgent Count
Average Wait Time (minutes)
features.PIC-002-input:
Order ID, Worker ID (Required)
Assignment Quantity (Optional)
features.PIC-002-output:
Assignment ID, Assignment Status
Estimated Processing Time (minutes)
Worker's Current Tasks
features.PIC-003-desc: Select products by order and mark picking as complete
features.PIC-003-input:
Assignment ID, Product ID (Required)
Picking Quantity, Lot Number (Required)
features.PIC-003-output:
Picking ID, Picking Status
Completion Rate (%)
Error Message
features.PIC-004-desc: Detect errors by scanning picked product barcodes
features.PIC-004-input:
Assignment ID, Barcode Data (Required)
Expected Product ID (Required)
features.PIC-004-output:
Verification Result (Normal/Error/Warning)
Scanned Product ID
Mismatch Status, Message
features.PIC-005-desc: Automatically generate packing list after picking completion
features.PIC-005-output:
Packing List ID
Packing List (Product, Quantity, Location)
Generation Status, Output File (PDF)
features.PIC-006-desc: Automatically generate and print shipping labels/tags
features.PIC-006-input:
Order ID, Shipping Company (Required)
Label Format (Standard A4/Small/Large)
features.PIC-006-output:
Shipping Label ID, Tracking Number
Barcode Image
Output File (PDF)
features.PIC-007-desc: Worker picking efficiency and productivity statistics
features.PIC-007-output:
Worker List (Worker, Processed Count, Processed Qty, Error Rate)
Average Processing Time (minutes)
Productivity Ranking, Efficiency Chart
features.PIC-008-input:
Query Date (Optional, Default: Today)
Refresh Interval (Real-time/5min/10min)
features.PIC-008-output:
Total Orders, Picking Complete
Picking In Progress, Picking Pending
Completion Rate (%), Status Chart
features.PIC-009-desc: Bundle multiple orders into one box
features.PIC-009-input:
Order ID Array (Required)
Box Information (Optional, Size/Weight/Special Notes)
features.PIC-009-output:
Bundle ID, Bundle Status
Included Orders (List)
Integrated Tracking Number
features.PIC-010-input:
Return ID (Required)
Picking Quantity, Pickup Handler (Required)
features.PIC-010-output:
Return Picking ID, Processing Status
Pickup Complete Time
Pickup Record
features.RET-001-input:
Order ID (Required)
Return Reason (Defective/Color Difference/Delivery Error/Customer Change of Mind)
Return Quantity (Required)
Customer Memo (Optional)
features.RET-001-output:
Return ID, Registration Status
Return Status (Request Time, Status, Expected Processing Date)
Shipping Info (Return Address, Contact)
features.RET-002-desc: Inspect returned products and verify condition
features.RET-002-input:
Return ID (Required)
Receipt Confirmation (Required)
Product Condition (Good/Damaged/Contaminated/Unopened)
Inspection Memo (Optional)
features.RET-002-output:
Inspection ID, Inspection Result (Approved/Partial Approval/Rejected)
Inspection Completion Time
Processing Procedure (Guidance)
features.RET-003-desc: Classify defective products by cause based on inspection results
features.RET-003-input:
Inspection ID (Required)
Defect Classification (Manufacturing Defect/Delivery Damage/Post-Service Defect)
Detailed Cause, Product Status Code (Required)
features.RET-003-output:
Classification ID, Classification Result
Processing Plan (How to reflect in inventory)
Statistics Reflection
features.RET-004-desc: View return status from receipt to completion
features.RET-004-input:
Return ID (Optional)
Period Filter (All/7 Days/30 Days)
Status Filter (All/In Progress/Completed/Rejected)
features.RET-004-output:
Return List (Return ID, Status, Receipt Date, Expected Processing Date)
Status Statistics (In Progress, Completed, Rejected)
Status Timeline (Stage, Time, Handler)
features.RET-005-desc: Return rate analysis report by product/cause
features.RET-005-input:
Inquiry Period (Monthly/Quarterly/Annual)
Analysis Criteria (By Product/By Reason/By Customer)
features.RET-005-output:
Return Statistics (Item, Return Count, Return Rate)
Ranking (Top Return Products/Reasons)
Trend Analysis (Return Rate Trend Chart)
Report (PDF)
features.RET-006-input:
Return ID, Exchange Request Product ID (Required)
Color/Size (Optional)
features.RET-006-output:
Exchange ID, Exchange Status (Application/Approval/Shipping/Complete)
Original Product, New Product
features.RET-007-desc: Manage refund process upon return approval
features.RET-007-input:
Return ID, Refund Amount (Required)
Refund Reason (Return Approved/Partial Approval/Rejection Processing)
features.RET-007-output:
Refund ID, Refund Status (Approved/In Progress/Complete/Failed)
Refund Amount, Refund Completion Date
features.OUT-001-desc: Process shipping for completed picking products
features.OUT-001-input:
Order ID, Shipping Company Selection (Required)
Shipping Fee, Shipping Address (Required)
features.OUT-001-output:
Shipping ID, Tracking Number
Shipping Status (In Transit/Delivered/Scheduled)
Shipping Start Time, Expected Delivery Date
features.OUT-002-desc: Automatically generate tracking numbers via shipping company API integration
features.OUT-002-input:
Shipping Company Code (Required)
Shipping Info (Recipient, Delivery Address, Product Info) (Required)
features.OUT-002-output:
Tracking Number
Integration Status (Success/Failed)
API Response
features.OUT-003-output:
Current Status
Shipping Progress Route (Stage, Time, Location, Memo)
Expected Delivery Time, Delivery Location (Latitude, Longitude)
features.OUT-004-desc: Automatic notification when shipping is delayed
features.OUT-004-input:
Tracking Number (Required)
Delay Threshold Time (Optional, Default: 24 hours)
features.OUT-004-output:
Delay Alert ID, Delay Status
Delay Time (hours)
Notification Status (Sent/Pending)
features.OUT-005-desc: International shipping company integration and customs information
features.OUT-005-input:
Shipping Country, International Carrier (Required)
Product Info (Product Name, Origin, Price)
features.OUT-005-output:
International Shipping ID
Customs Info (Tariff Rate, Expected Customs, HS Code)
Tracking Number, Customs Status (In Customs/Complete/On Hold)
features.USER-001-desc: Create WMS user accounts and set permissions
features.USER-001-input:
Username, Password (Required)
Employee Name, Department (Required)
Position (Admin/Manager/Worker)
features.USER-001-output:
User ID, Creation Status
Initial Account Info (Username, Initial Password, Temporary Token)
Creation Time
features.USER-002-input:
User ID (Required)
Permission Level (Admin/Manager/Worker/Viewer)
Menu Permissions (Optional: Menu, Read, Write, Delete)
features.USER-002-output:
Permission Setting ID, Setting Status
Applied Permissions (List of permissions granted to user)
features.USER-003-desc: Secure user authentication and session management
features.USER-003-output:
Authentication Result (Success/Failed)
Session Token
User Info (ID, Name, Department, Permissions)
Login Time
features.USER-004-desc: Save and view all user activity records
features.USER-004-input:
Period Filter (Optional: All/7 Days/30 Days)
User Filter, Task Filter (Optional)
features.USER-004-output:
Log List (Time, User, Task, Target, Result)
Total Log Count
Statistics (Aggregation by User, by Task)
features.RPT-001-desc: Daily transaction status including inbound, outbound, picking, and returns
features.RPT-001-input:
Reference Date (Required, Default: Current Day)
Time Unit (Optional: Hourly/Daily)
features.RPT-001-output:
Inbound Count, Inbound Quantity
Outbound Count, Outbound Quantity
Picking Count, Return Count, Shipping Count
Statistics Data (Hourly transaction volume details)
features.RPT-002-input:
Reference Week (Optional: This Week/Last Week/Specific Week)
Comparison Target (Optional: Previous Week/Previous Month/Same Week Last Year)
features.RPT-002-output:
Weekly Statistics (Inbound, Outbound, Picking, Return, Shipping)
Comparison Data (Growth rate vs. previous week)
Key Indicators (Productivity, Error Rate, Delivery Rate)
Trend Graph (Weekly daily transaction volume graph)
features.RPT-003-desc: Monthly inventory increase/decrease and turnover rate analysis
features.RPT-003-input:
Inquiry Month (Required)
Product Filter (Optional: Specific Product/Category)
features.RPT-003-output:
Monthly Data (Product, Opening Stock, Inbound, Outbound, Closing Stock)
Turnover Rate (Product, Rate)
Report File (PDF)
features.RPT-004-desc: Product sales volume and popularity ranking
features.RPT-004-input:
Period Filter (Required: Monthly/Quarterly/Semi-annual/Annual)
Category Filter (Optional)
Sort Criteria (Optional: Sales Volume/Sales Amount/Popularity)
features.RPT-004-output:
Sales Ranking (Rank, Product Name, Sales Volume, Sales Amount)
Top Products (Top 10 Products)
Ranking Chart (Sales volume bar chart by product)
features.RPT-005-desc: Analyze inventory turnover rate by product
features.RPT-005-output:
Turnover Rate Data (Product, Turnover Rate, Evaluation)
High Turnover Products (Top 10)
Low Turnover Products (Bottom 10)
Analysis Chart (Turnover rate analysis chart)
features.RPT-006-input:
Period Filter (Required: Monthly/Quarterly)
Outsourcing Partner Filter (Optional)
features.RPT-006-output:
Partner List (Partner, Processing Count, Processing Quantity, Efficiency)
Ranking (Processing volume ranking by partner)
Chart (Comparison chart by partner)
features.CFG-001-input:
Warehouse Name, Location (Required)
Capacity (m³, Required)
Zone Info (Zone Name, Shelf Count, Capacity per Bin)
features.CFG-001-output:
Warehouse ID, Registration Status
Warehouse Info (Registered warehouse detailed information)
Zone List (Created zone list)
features.CFG-002-desc: Register shipping company information for integration
features.CFG-002-input:
Shipping Company Name, Company Code (Required)
API Key, API Endpoint (Required)
features.CFG-002-output:
Shipping Company ID, Registration Status
Integration Status (Normal/Error)
features.CFG-003-input:
Classification Name (Required)
Classification Type (Category/Brand/Tag)
Parent Classification (Optional: Hierarchical Structure)
features.CFG-003-output:
Classification ID, Registration Status
Classification Structure (Hierarchical structure information)
features.CFG-004-desc: Rules such as inventory alert values, picking priority, etc.
features.CFG-004-input:
Rule Name (Required)
Rule Type (Stock Alert/Picking Priority/Shipping Rule)
Rule Condition, Rule Action (Required)
features.CFG-004-output:
Rule ID, Registration Status (Active/Inactive)
Application Target (Scope where rule is applied)
features.CFG-001-process:
Admin selects warehouse addition menu
Enter warehouse basic information (name, location, capacity)
Enter zone information (zone name, shelf count, etc.)
Validate input
Create warehouse record
Create records for each zone
Save warehouse information
Registration completion message
features.CFG-002-process:
Admin selects shipping company addition
Enter shipping company information (name, code, API info)
Test API connection
Save information on successful connection
Display error message on connection failure
Save shipping company information to DB
Activate for use during shipping
features.CFG-003-process:
Admin selects classification addition
Enter classification name
Select classification type (Category/Brand/Tag)
Select parent classification (hierarchical structure)
Validate classification information
Create classification record
Save classification
Available for use during product registration
features.CFG-004-process:
Admin selects rule addition
Enter rule name
Select rule type (Stock Alert/Picking Priority, etc.)
Enter rule condition (condition expression)
Define rule execution action
Validate rule
Save rule
System automatically executes rule when condition detected
features.OUT-001-process:
Query orders completed picking/packing
Select shipping company and enter shipping fee
Final confirmation of shipping address
Create shipping record
Update order status (Preparing → In Transit)
Generate tracking number via shipping company API (if automated)
Save shipping information
Send shipping start notification to customer
features.OUT-002-process:
Select shipping company and prepare shipping information
Query shipping company API endpoint
Connect with authentication key
Convert shipping information to shipping company API format
Send API request
Receive tracking number
Save tracking number to DB
Provide tracking number to customer
features.OUT-003-process:
Enter tracking number and shipping company
Request tracking to shipping company API
Receive current shipping status
Parse shipping progress route data
Calculate expected delivery time
Request current location to map API (if GPS data available)
Display tracking information on screen (timeline + map)
Notify customer when shipping status changes
features.OUT-004-process:
Query shipping information
Compare expected delivery time with current time
Check if delay threshold time exceeded
Create alert record when delay confirmed
Send delay notification to customer
Notify delivery handler
Investigate delay reason
Take additional action (contact shipping company, etc.)
features.OUT-005-process:
Select international shipping country
Enter product origin and price information
Auto-query or manually enter HS code
Query tariff rate for the country
Calculate expected customs
Integrate international carrier API
Generate international tracking number
Monitor and notify customs information
features.PIC-001-process:
Filter orders in WMS with picking pending status
Apply additional filtering by filter status (Urgent/Normal)
Apply sort order
Query product information for each order
Calculate wait time
Display order list on screen
features.PIC-002-process:
Select order and assign worker
Verify product list for assigned order
Check worker's current workload
Calculate estimated processing time
Update order status (Preparing → Picking)
Deliverpicking list to worker
Create task assignment record
Send notification to worker
features.PIC-003-process:
Worker reviews picking list
Move to specified product location in warehouse
Verify and input product lot number
Input actual picked quantity
Verify picked quantity matches order quantity
Handle error or additional picking if mismatch
Click complete button
Save picking record and update progress rate
Proceed to next step when all products picked
features.PIC-004-process:
Worker scans picked product barcode
Extract Product ID from barcode
Compare with expected Product ID on order
Match → Return 'Normal' and proceed
Mismatch → Return 'Error' and alert
Worker re-verifies correct product on error
Save verification record
features.PIC-005-process:
Verify picking completed order
Validate all products in order are picked
Select packing format
Generate packing information (product name, quantity, size, color, etc.)
Add shipping information
Generate packing list PDF
Save record
Prepare for printing
features.PIC-006-process:
Select order and shipping company
Select label format
Query customer shipping address
Generate tracking number via shipping company API (or manual input)
Generate tracking number barcode
Create shipping label layout
Generate PDF file
Send to printer or provide download
features.PIC-007-process:
Select period filter
Query all picking task records for the period
Aggregate count, quantity, time by worker
Calculate error rate by worker
Calculate average processing time
Determine efficiency ranking
Generate comparison chart
Display report screen
features.PIC-008-process:
Select query date
Query all orders for the date
Check picking status for each order
Aggregate count by status (Complete/In Progress/Pending)
Calculate completion rate
Refresh real-time or periodically
Generate dashboard chart
Display on screen
features.PIC-009-process:
Select multiple orders
Verify shipping addresses of selected orders
Validate addresses match
Input box information (optional)
Create bundle
Generate integrated tracking number (shipping company API)
Save bundle information
Prepare for shipping
features.PIC-010-process:
Query return request information
Verify return product location
Handler collects return product
Input collected quantity
Verify product condition
Update return status
Save pickup record
Proceed to inspection process
features.RET-001-process:
Customer accesses return request page
Search and select order
Select return reason
Enter return quantity
Enter additional memo (optional)
Agree to return policy
Register return request
Create return record and set status to 'Requested'
Provide customer with Return ID and pickup information
features.RET-002-process:
Return handler confirms arrived return products
Scan Return ID to retrieve return request information
Confirm received quantity and compare with ordered quantity
Inspect condition of each product (damage, contamination, unopened, etc.)
Record inspection results
Determine approval/partial approval/rejection based on results
Update return status
Notify customer of inspection results
features.RET-003-process:
Select inspected return products
Select defect classification (Manufacturing/Delivery/Post-Service)
Record detailed cause
Assign product status code (Disposal/Recoverable/Resellable)
Save classification record
Reflect as defective status in inventory
Update classification statistics
Notify responsible team (Quality Control)
features.RET-004-process:
Enter Return ID or filter conditions
Query corresponding return records from DB
Check current status of each return
Display progress timeline by stage
Calculate status statistics
Display list screen
features.RET-005-process:
Select inquiry period
Select analysis criteria
Query all return records for the period
Aggregate count by criteria
Calculate return rate vs. total sales
Determine rankings
Generate trend data
Generate report and display charts
features.RET-006-process:
Change return request to exchange application
Select exchange request product
Enter changes such as color/size
Confirm original and new product information
Check new product inventory
Create exchange application
Proceed with approval process
Prepare new product for shipment after approval
features.RET-007-process:
Decide return approval or partial approval
Confirm refund amount
Select refund reason
Create refund record
Request refund to payment system
Monitor refund progress status
Confirm refund completion
Notify customer of refund completion
features.RPT-001-process:
Select reference date (or default to current day)
Query all transaction records for the date from DB
Aggregate by transaction type (Inbound/Outbound/Picking/Return/Shipping)
Calculate hourly detailed data when time unit selected
Calculate figures for each indicator
Generate statistics charts/graphs
Display on report screen
features.RPT-002-process:
Set reference week
Query all transaction data for the week (Mon-Sun)
Calculate weekly total for each indicator
Query comparison target week data
Calculate growth rate
Calculate key KPIs such as productivity, error rate
Generate daily trend data
Create and display dashboard charts
features.RPT-003-process:
Select inquiry month
Apply product filter (optional)
Query opening stock
Aggregate monthly inbound amount
Aggregate monthly outbound amount
Calculate closing stock
Calculate turnover rate (monthly outbound / average stock)
Generate and display report PDF
features.RPT-004-process:
Select period
Apply category filter (optional)
Query all sales records for the period
Aggregate sales volume by product
Calculate sales amount by product
Calculate popularity score
Apply sorting criteria
Determine rankings and generate charts
features.RPT-005-process:
Select analysis period
Apply category filter (optional)
Calculate average stock for each product during period
Calculate sales volume for each product during period
Calculate turnover rate (sales volume / average stock)
Sort products by turnover rate
Distinguish high/low turnover products
Generate and analyze charts
features.RPT-006-process:
Select period
Apply outsourcing partner filter (optional)
Query outsourcing records for the period from DB
Aggregate count by partner
Aggregate quantity by partner
Calculate efficiency score
Determine rankings
Generate comparison chart
features.USER-001-process:
Admin selects user addition menu
Enter user information (ID, password, name, etc.)
Validate input (required fields, format)
Check for duplicate ID
Create user account
Assign default permissions
Set temporary initial password
Save user record
Output created account information
features.USER-002-process:
Select user
Select permission level (Admin/Manager/Worker/Viewer)
Auto-assign default permissions according to level
Set additional detailed permissions per menu (optional)
Validate permission information
Save permission settings
Apply new permissions on user login
Record change history
features.USER-003-process:
Enter ID/password on login page
Validate input (required, format)
Query user information from DB
Compare entered password with stored password (hashing)
Generate session token on successful authentication
Record login information
Load user permission information
Redirect to dashboard
Terminate session and invalidate token on logout
features.USER-004-process:
Admin accesses log inquiry page
Set period, user, task filters
Query all corresponding task logs from DB
Search and sort log list
Paging processing
Aggregate statistics data
Display log list screen
Enable detailed view or download
